description: The cluster quality of service - virtual machines dashboard contains reports that shows the time and total time each virtual machine have preformed above/below the CPU or the memory threshold, using a single stats and a table.

panels.content: ###### This dashboard contains reports that shows the time and total time each virtual machine have preformed above/below the CPU/memory threshold.

panels.description: This report displays the time virtual machines have preformed above CPU threshold.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR13 - VMs cpu and memory performance
-- in relation to the thresholds set by the user

-- Time above CPU threshold
SELECT  
    CASE 
        -- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back
        WHEN $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
            THEN
                (
                    SELECT
                        COALESCE ( AVG ( cpu_above ), 0 ) AS cpu_above
                    FROM 
                        (
                            SELECT
                                SUM 
                                    (
                                        CASE
                                            WHEN cpu_usage_percent >= '$cpu_threshold'
                                                THEN minutes_in_status
                                            ELSE 0
                                        END
                                    ) AS cpu_above
                            FROM 
                                (
                                    SELECT DISTINCT
                                        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id,
                                        history_datetime,
                                        cpu_usage_percent,
                                        minutes_in_status
                                    FROM
                                        (
                                            SELECT history_datetime, vm_id, cpu_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, vm_status 
                                            FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
                                        ) AS stats_vms
                                        INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms
                                            ON 
                                                (
                                                    v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id =
                                                    stats_vms.vm_id
                                                )
                                    WHERE
                                        -- Here we filter only vm in active status
                                        stats_vms.vm_status = 1
                                        -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the users
                                        AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id 
                                            IN 
                                                (
                                                    SELECT cluster_id
                                                    FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
                                                    WHERE datacenter_id = '$datacenter_id'
                                                )
                                        -- Here we filter by the virtual machine/s chosen by the user
                                        AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id IN ($vm_id)
                                        -- Here we get the latest vm configurations
                                        AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.history_id 
                                            IN 
                                                (
                                                    SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                                                    FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms a
                                                    GROUP BY a.vm_id
                                                )
                                        AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                                        AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                                        -- This will determine if deleted entities will be included in the report,
                                        -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
                                        AND
                                            CASE
                                                WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                                    THEN 1=1
                                                WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                                    THEN delete_date isnull
                                            END
                                ) AS sub_query
                            GROUP BY vm_id
                        ) AS samples_sub_queries
                )
        -- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
        WHEN $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
            THEN
                (
                    SELECT
                        COALESCE ( AVG ( cpu_above ), 0 ) AS cpu_above 
                    FROM 
                        (
                            SELECT
                                SUM 
                                    (
                                        CASE
                                            WHEN cpu_usage_percent >= '$cpu_threshold'
                                                THEN minutes_in_status
                                            ELSE 0
                                        END
                                    ) AS cpu_above
                            FROM 
                                (
                                    SELECT DISTINCT
                                        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id,
                                        history_datetime,
                                        cpu_usage_percent,
                                        minutes_in_status
                                    FROM
                                        (
                                                SELECT history_datetime, vm_id, cpu_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, vm_status 
                                                FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                                            UNION
                                                SELECT history_datetime, vm_id, cpu_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, vm_status
                                                FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_daily
                                                WHERE
                                                    history_datetime <
                                                        (
                                                            SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                                            FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                                                        )
                                        ) AS stats_vms
                                        INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms
                                            ON 
                                                (
                                                    v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id =
                                                    stats_vms.vm_id
                                                )
                                    WHERE
                                        -- Here we filter only vm in active status
                                        stats_vms.vm_status = 1
                                        -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the users
                                        AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id 
                                            IN 
                                                (
                                                    SELECT cluster_id
                                                    FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
                                                    WHERE datacenter_id = '$datacenter_id'
                                                )
                                        -- Here we filter by the virtual machine/s chosen by the user
                                        AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id IN ($vm_id)
                                        -- Here we get the latest vm configurations
                                        AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.history_id 
                                            IN 
                                                (
                                                    SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                                                    FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms a
                                                    GROUP BY a.vm_id
                                                )
                                        AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                                        AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                                        -- This will determine if deleted entities will be included in the report,
                                        -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
                                        AND
                                            CASE
                                                WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                                    THEN 1=1
                                                WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                                    THEN delete_date isnull
                                            END
                                ) AS sub_query
                            GROUP BY vm_id
                        ) AS hourly_daily_sub_queries
                )
    END

panels.title: Time Above CPU Threshold (BR13)

panels.description: This report displays the time virtual machines have performed above memory threshold.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR13 - VMs cpu and memory performance
-- in relation to the thresholds set by the user

-- Time above memory threshold
SELECT  
    CASE 
        -- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back
        WHEN $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
            THEN
                (
                    SELECT
                        COALESCE ( AVG ( mem_above ), 0 ) AS mem_above
                    FROM 
                        (
                            SELECT
                                SUM 
                                    (
                                        CASE
                                            WHEN memory_usage_percent >= '$mem_threshold'
                                                THEN minutes_in_status
                                            ELSE 0
                                        END
                                    ) AS mem_above
                            FROM 
                                (
                                    SELECT DISTINCT
                                        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id,
                                        history_datetime,
                                        memory_usage_percent,
                                        minutes_in_status
                                    FROM
                                        (
                                            SELECT history_datetime, vm_id, memory_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, vm_status 
                                            FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
                                        ) AS stats_vms
                                        INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms
                                            ON 
                                                (
                                                    v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id =
                                                    stats_vms.vm_id
                                                )
                                    WHERE
                                        -- Here we filter only vm in active status
                                        stats_vms.vm_status = 1
                                        -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the users
                                        AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id 
                                            IN 
                                                (
                                                    SELECT cluster_id
                                                    FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
                                                    WHERE datacenter_id = '$datacenter_id'

                                        -- Here we filter by the virtual machine/s chosen by the user

                                                    THEN 1=1
                                                WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                                    THEN delete_date isnull
                                            END
                                ) AS sub_query

        -- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
        WHEN $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
            THEN
                (
                    SELECT
                        COALESCE ( AVG ( mem_above ), 0 ) AS mem_above 
                    FROM 
                        (
                            SELECT
                                SUM 
                                    (
                                        CASE
                                            WHEN memory_usage_percent >= '$mem_threshold'
                                                THEN minutes_in_status

                                        END
                                    ) AS mem_above
                            FROM 
                                (
                                    SELECT DISTINCT
                                        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id,
                                        history_datetime,
                                        memory_usage_percent,
                                        minutes_in_status
                                    FROM
                                        (
                                                SELECT history_datetime, vm_id, memory_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, vm_status 
                                                FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                                            UNION
                                                SELECT history_datetime, vm_id, memory_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, vm_status
                                                FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_daily
                                                WHERE
                                                    history_datetime <
                                                        (
                                                            SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                                            FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                                                        )
                                        ) AS stats_vms
                                        INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms
                                            ON 
                                                (
                                                    v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id =
                                                    stats_vms.vm_id
                                                )
                                    WHERE
                                        -- Here we filter only vm in active status
                                        stats_vms.vm_status = 1
                                        -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the users
                                        AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id 
                                            IN 
                                                (
                                                    SELECT cluster_id
                                                    FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
                                                    WHERE datacenter_id = '$datacenter_id'
                                                )
                                        -- Here we filter by the virtual machine/s chosen by the user
                                        AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id IN ($vm_id)
                                        -- Here we get the latest vm configurations
                                        AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.history_id 
                                            IN 
                                                (
                                                    SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                                                    FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms a
                                                    GROUP BY a.vm_id

                                        AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()

                                        -- This will determine if deleted entities will be included in the report,
                                        -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter

panels.title: Time Above Memory Threshold (BR13)

targets.rawSql:
-- BR13 - VMs cpu and memory performance
-- in relation to the thresholds set by the user

-- Time below CPU threshold
SELECT  
    CASE 
        -- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back

            THEN

                    SELECT
                        COALESCE ( AVG ( cpu_below ), 0 ) AS cpu_below

                                            ELSE 0
                                        END

                                (
                                    SELECT DISTINCT
                                        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id,

                                    FROM
                                        (
                                                SELECT history_datetime, vm_id, cpu_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, vm_status

                                            UNION
                                                SELECT history_datetime, vm_id, cpu_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, vm_status
                                                FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_daily
                                                WHERE
                                                    history_datetime <
                                                        (
                                                            SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                                            FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                                                        )
                                        ) AS stats_vms

panels.title: Time Below CPU Threshold (BR13)

panels.description: This report displays the time virtual machines have performed below memory threshold.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR13 - VMs cpu and memory performance
-- in relation to the thresholds set by the user

-- Time below memory threshold
SELECT  
    CASE 
        -- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back
        WHEN $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
            THEN
                (
                    SELECT
                        COALESCE ( AVG ( mem_below ), 0 ) AS mem_below
                    FROM 
                        (
                            SELECT
                                SUM 
                                    (
                                        CASE
                                            WHEN memory_usage_percent < '$mem_threshold'
                                                THEN minutes_in_status
                                            ELSE 0
                                        END
                                    ) AS mem_below
                            FROM 
                                (
                                    SELECT DISTINCT
                                        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id,
                                        history_datetime,
                                        memory_usage_percent,
                                        minutes_in_status
                                    FROM
                                        (
                                            SELECT history_datetime, vm_id, memory_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, vm_status 
                                            FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
                                        ) AS stats_vms
                                        INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms
                                            ON 
                                                (
                                                    v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id =
                                                    stats_vms.vm_id
                                                )
                                    WHERE
                                        -- Here we filter only vm in active status
                                        stats_vms.vm_status = 1
                                        -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the users
                                        AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id 
                                            IN 
                                                (
                                                    SELECT cluster_id
                                                    FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
                                                    WHERE datacenter_id = '$datacenter_id'
                                                )
                                        -- Here we filter by the virtual machine/s chosen by the user
                                        AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id IN ($vm_id)
                                        -- Here we get the latest vm configurations
                                        AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.history_id 
                                            IN 
                                                (

                                                    FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms a
                                                    GROUP BY a.vm_id
                                                )
                                        AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                                        AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                                        -- This will determine if deleted entities will be included in the report,
                                        -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
                                        AND
                                            CASE
                                                WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                                    THEN 1=1
                                                WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                                    THEN delete_date isnull
                                            END
                                ) AS sub_query
                            GROUP BY vm_id
                        ) AS samples_sub_queries
                )
        -- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
        WHEN $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
            THEN
                (
                    SELECT
                        COALESCE ( AVG ( mem_below ), 0 ) AS mem_below 
                    FROM 
                        (
                            SELECT
                                SUM 
                                    (
                                        CASE
                                            WHEN memory_usage_percent < '$mem_threshold'
                                                THEN minutes_in_status
                                            ELSE 0
                                        END
                                    ) AS mem_below
                            FROM 
                                (
                                    SELECT DISTINCT
                                        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id,
                                        history_datetime,
                                        memory_usage_percent,
                                        minutes_in_status
                                    FROM
                                        (
                                                SELECT history_datetime, vm_id, memory_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, vm_status 
                                                FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                                            UNION
                                                SELECT history_datetime, vm_id, memory_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, vm_status
                                                FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_daily
                                                WHERE
                                                    history_datetime <
                                                        (
                                                            SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                                            FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                                                        )
                                        ) AS stats_vms
                                        INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms
                                            ON 
                                                (
                                                    v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id =
                                                    stats_vms.vm_id
                                                )
                                    WHERE
                                        -- Here we filter only vm in active status
                                        stats_vms.vm_status = 1
                                        -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the users
                                        AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id 
                                            IN 
                                                (
                                                    SELECT cluster_id
                                                    FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
                                                    WHERE datacenter_id = '$datacenter_id'

                                        -- Here we filter by the virtual machine/s chosen by the user
                                        AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id IN ($vm_id)
                                        -- Here we get the latest vm configurations

panels.title: Time Below Memory Threshold (BR13)

panels.description: This report displays the total time each virtual machine have performed above the CPU or the memory threshold.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR13 - Cluster Quality of Service - Virtual Machines
-- This query returns for each vm in the specific datacenter,
-- the  "time_above_cpu_threshold", the "time_above_mem_threshold"
-- and the "overall_vm_time".

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.
SELECT *
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            cluster_id,
            vm_id,
            vm_name,
            is_delete,
            vm_delete_only_date,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN cpu_usage_percent >= '$cpu_threshold'
                            THEN minutes_in_status
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS time_above_cpu_threshold,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN memory_usage_percent >= '$mem_threshold'
                            THEN minutes_in_status
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS time_above_mem_threshold,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS overall_vm_time
        FROM 
            (
                SELECT DISTINCT
                    v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id,
                    v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id,
                    v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_name,
                    (
                        CASE
                            WHEN v4_3_configuration_history_vms.delete_date IS NULL
                                THEN FALSE
                            ELSE TRUE
                        END
                    ) AS is_delete,
                    CAST ( v4_3_configuration_history_vms.delete_date AS date ) AS vm_delete_only_date,
                    stats_vms.history_datetime,
                    cpu_usage_percent,
                    memory_usage_percent,
                    minutes_in_status
                FROM
                    (
                        SELECT history_datetime, vm_id, cpu_usage_percent, memory_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, vm_status 
                        FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
                    ) AS stats_vms
                    INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms
                        ON 
                            (
                                stats_vms.vm_id =
                                v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id
                            )
                WHERE
                    -- Here we get only vms in active status
                    stats_vms.vm_status = 1
                    -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
                    AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id 
                        IN 
                            (
                                SELECT cluster_id
                                FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
                                WHERE datacenter_id = '$datacenter_id'
                            )
                    -- Here we filter by the virtual machine/s chosen by the user
                    AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id IN ($vm_id)
                    -- Here we get the latest vm configurations
                    AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.history_id 
                        IN 
                            (
                                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                                FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms a
                                GROUP BY a.vm_id
                            )
                    AND stats_vms.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                    AND stats_vms.history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                    -- This will determine if deleted entities will be included in the report,
                    -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
                    AND
                        CASE
                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                THEN 1=1
                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                THEN delete_date isnull
                        END
            ) AS sub_query
        GROUP BY
            cluster_id,
            vm_id,
            vm_name,
            is_delete,
            vm_delete_only_date
    ) AS all_sub_queries
-- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
WHERE $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
ORDER BY
    cluster_id,
    (
        CASE
            WHEN time_above_mem_threshold = 0 AND time_above_cpu_threshold = 0
                THEN 1 -- Memory and cpu are below the threshold
            ELSE 0 -- Memory and / or cpu are above threshold
        END
    ) ASC,
    all_sub_queries.is_delete ASC,
    -- This will order the vms based on the time the memory and cpu
    -- where above the threshold out of the overall vm time.
    ( CAST ( all_sub_queries.time_above_cpu_threshold AS float ) / CAST ( all_sub_queries.overall_vm_time AS float ) ) * 100 +
    ( CAST ( all_sub_queries.time_above_mem_threshold AS float ) / CAST ( all_sub_queries.overall_vm_time AS float ) ) *100 DESC

-- BR13 - Cluster Quality of Service - Virtual Machines
-- This query returns for each vm in the specific datacenter,
-- the  "time_above_cpu_threshold", the "time_above_mem_threshold"
-- and the "overall_vm_time".

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.
SELECT *
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            cluster_id,
            vm_id,
            vm_name,
            is_delete,
            vm_delete_only_date,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN cpu_usage_percent >= '$cpu_threshold'
                            THEN minutes_in_status
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS time_above_cpu_threshold,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN memory_usage_percent >= '$mem_threshold'
                            THEN minutes_in_status
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS time_above_mem_threshold,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS overall_vm_time
        FROM 
            (
                SELECT DISTINCT
                    v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id,
                    v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id,
                    v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_name,
                    (
                        CASE
                            WHEN v4_3_configuration_history_vms.delete_date IS NULL
                                THEN FALSE
                            ELSE TRUE
                        END
                    ) AS is_delete,
                    CAST ( v4_3_configuration_history_vms.delete_date AS date ) AS vm_delete_only_date,
                    stats_vms.history_datetime,
                    cpu_usage_percent,
                    memory_usage_percent,
                    minutes_in_status
                FROM
                    (
                            SELECT history_datetime, vm_id, cpu_usage_percent, memory_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, vm_status 
                            FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                        UNION
                            SELECT history_datetime, vm_id, cpu_usage_percent, memory_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, vm_status
                            FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_daily
                            WHERE
                                history_datetime <
                                    (
                                        SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                        FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                                    )
                    ) AS stats_vms
                    INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms
                        ON 
                            (
                                stats_vms.vm_id =
                                v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id
                            )
                WHERE
                    -- Here we get only vms in active status
                    stats_vms.vm_status = 1
                    -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
                    AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id 
                        IN 
                            (
                                SELECT cluster_id
                                FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
                                WHERE datacenter_id = '$datacenter_id'
                            )
                    -- Here we filter by the virtual machine/s chosen by the user
                    AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id IN ($vm_id)
                    -- Here we get the latest vm configurations
                    AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.history_id 
                        IN 
                            (
                                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                                FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms a
                                GROUP BY a.vm_id
                            )
                    AND stats_vms.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                    AND stats_vms.history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                    -- This will determine if deleted entities will be included in the report,
                    -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
                    AND
                        CASE
                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                THEN 1=1
                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                THEN delete_date isnull
                        END
            ) AS sub_query
        GROUP BY
            cluster_id,
            vm_id,
            vm_name,
            is_delete,
            vm_delete_only_date
    ) AS all_sub_queries
-- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
WHERE $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
ORDER BY
    cluster_id,
    (
        CASE
            WHEN time_above_mem_threshold = 0 AND time_above_cpu_threshold = 0
                THEN 1 -- Memory and cpu are below the threshold
            ELSE 0 -- Memory and / or cpu are above threshold
        END
    ) ASC,
    all_sub_queries.is_delete ASC,
    -- This will order the vms based on the time the memory and cpu
    -- where above the threshold out of the overall vm time.
    ( CAST ( all_sub_queries.time_above_cpu_threshold AS float ) / CAST ( all_sub_queries.overall_vm_time AS float ) ) * 100 +
    ( CAST ( all_sub_queries.time_above_mem_threshold AS float ) / CAST ( all_sub_queries.overall_vm_time AS float ) ) *100 DESC

panels.title: Cluster Quality of Service - Virtual Machines (BR13)

list.definition: SELECT DISTINCT   CAST ( datacenter_id AS varchar ) AS __value,  CASE          WHEN delete_date IS NULL  	     	    THEN datacenter_name 	 	WHEN delete_date IS NOT null  	      	    THEN datacenter_name || ' (Removed on ' || CAST ( CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')'  END AS __text  		FROM v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters  		WHERE       		    history_id           			    IN               				(  	             					SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )  		         					FROM v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters a  		         					GROUP BY a.datacenter_id 	         				) 	 			AND datacenter_id  	         			    IN 			     				    ( 					 						SELECT DISTINCT datacenter_id 					 						FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters 					 						WHERE  					     						    cluster_id 					         						        IN 					             						            ( 									 										SELECT DISTINCT cluster_id 									 										FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms  								 									) 				 					) 	 			AND 	    			    CASE  	        				    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes' 	            					    THEN 1=1 		    					WHEN '$show_deleted'='No' 		        					    THEN v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters.delete_date ISNULL 	                END
list.label: Data Center
list.name: datacenter_id
list.query: SELECT DISTINCT   CAST ( datacenter_id AS varchar ) AS __value,  CASE          WHEN delete_date IS NULL  	     	    THEN datacenter_name 	 	WHEN delete_date IS NOT null  	      	    THEN datacenter_name || ' (Removed on ' || CAST ( CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')'  END AS __text  		FROM v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters  		WHERE       		    history_id           			    IN               				(  	             					SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )  		         					FROM v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters a  		         					GROUP BY a.datacenter_id 	         				) 	 			AND datacenter_id  	         			    IN 			     				    ( 					 						SELECT DISTINCT datacenter_id 					 						FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters 					 						WHERE  					     						    cluster_id 					         						        IN 					             						            ( 									 										SELECT DISTINCT cluster_id 									 										FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms  								 									) 				 					) 	 			AND 	    			    CASE  	        				    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes' 	            					    THEN 1=1 		    					WHEN '$show_deleted'='No' 		        					    THEN v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters.delete_date ISNULL 	                END

list.definition: SELECT DISTINCT        CAST ( cluster_id AS varchar ) AS __value,  	CASE      	    WHEN delete_date IS NULL  	     		    THEN cluster_name 	 		WHEN delete_date IS NOT null  	      		    THEN cluster_name || ' (Removed on ' || CAST ( CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')'  	END AS __text  	FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters  	WHERE       	    history_id           		    IN               			    (  	             					SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )  		         					FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters a  		         					GROUP BY a.cluster_id 	         				) 	 		AND cluster_id  	         		    IN 			     			    ( 					 					SELECT DISTINCT cluster_id 					 					FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms 				 				) 	 		AND 	    		    CASE  	        			    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes' 	            				    THEN 1=1 		    				WHEN '$show_deleted'='No' 		        				    THEN v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date ISNULL 	    			END     		AND datacenter_id IN ('$datacenter_id')

list.definition: SELECT DISTINCT        CAST ( vm_id AS varchar ) AS __value,  	CASE      	    WHEN delete_date IS NULL  	     		    THEN vm_name 	 		WHEN delete_date IS NOT null  	      		    THEN vm_name || ' (Removed on ' || CAST ( CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')'  	END AS __text  	FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms  	WHERE       	    history_id           		    IN               			    (  	             					SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )  		         					FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms a  		         					GROUP BY a.vm_id 	         				) 	 		AND 	    		    CASE  	        			    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes' 	            				    THEN 1=1 		    				WHEN '$show_deleted'='No' 		        				    THEN v4_3_configuration_history_vms.delete_date ISNULL 	    			END     		AND cluster_id IN ('$cluster_id')
